text: Air Chief Marshal Farooq Feroze Khan (; 17 August 1939 â€“ 9 October 2021) (NI(m), HI(m), SI(m), SBt), best known as Feroze Khan, was a Pakistani four- star air officer in the Pakistan Air Force. He was the Chairman Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee from 1994 until retiring in 1997. He was born in Bombay, India. Khan died on 9 October 2021 at a hospital in Islamabad from a heart attack, aged 82. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Pakistani military people
title: Farooq Feroze Khan
